properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role_name
properties.description: • role_name - (Required) The name of the role.

properties.name: role_id
properties.description: • role_id - (Optional) The RoleID of this role. If not specified, one will be auto-generated.

properties.name: bind_secret_id
properties.description: • bind_secret_id - (Optional) Whether or not to require secret_id to be presented when logging in using this AppRole. Defaults to true.

properties.name: secret_id_bound_cidrs
properties.description: • secret_id_bound_cidrs - (Optional) If set, specifies blocks of IP addresses which can perform the login operation.

properties.name: secret_id_num_uses
properties.description: • secret_id_num_uses - (Optional) The number of times any particular SecretID can be used to fetch a token from this AppRole, after which the SecretID will expire. A value of zero will allow unlimited uses.

properties.name: secret_id_ttl
properties.description: • secret_id_ttl - (Optional) The number of seconds after which any SecretID expires.

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) The unique name of the auth backend to configure. Defaults to approle.

properties.name: common-token-arguments
properties.description: » Common Token Arguments
These arguments are common across several Authentication Token resources since Vault 1.2.

properties.name: token_ttl
properties.description: • token_ttl - (Optional) The incremental lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_max_ttl - (Optional) The maximum lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_policies
properties.description: • token_policies - (Optional) List of policies to encode onto generated tokens. Depending on the auth method, this list may be supplemented by user/group/other values.

properties.name: token_bound_cidrs
properties.description: • token_bound_cidrs - (Optional) List of CIDR blocks; if set, specifies blocks of IP addresses which can authenticate successfully, and ties the resulting token to these blocks as well.

properties.name: token_explicit_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_explicit_max_ttl - (Optional) If set, will encode an explicit max TTL onto the token in number of seconds. This is a hard cap even if token_ttl and token_max_ttl would otherwise allow a renewal.

properties.name: token_no_default_policy
properties.description: • token_no_default_policy - (Optional) If set, the default policy will not be set on generated tokens; otherwise it will be added to the policies set in token_policies.

properties.name: token_num_uses
properties.description: • token_num_uses - (Optional) The period, if any, in number of seconds to set on the token.

properties.name: token_type
properties.description: • token_type - (Optional) The type of token that should be generated. Can be service, batch, or default to use the mount's tuned default (which unless changed will be service tokens). For token store roles, there are two additional possibilities: default-service and default-batch which specify the type to return unless the client requests a different type at generation time.

properties.name: deprecated-arguments
properties.description: » Deprecated Arguments

properties.name: bound_cidr_list
properties.description: (Optional; Deprecated, use secret_id_bound_cidrs instead) If set, specifies blocks of IP addresses which can perform the login operation.
These arguments are deprecated since Vault 1.2 in favour of the common token arguments documented above.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_policies instead) An array of strings specifying the policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.

properties.name: period
properties.description: • period - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_period instead) If set, indicates that the token generated using this role should never expire. The token should be renewed within the duration specified by this value. At each renewal, the token's TTL will be set to the value of this field. The maximum allowed lifetime of token issued using this role. Specified as a number of seconds.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role_id
properties.description: • role_id - (Required) The ID of the role to log in with.

properties.name: secret_id
properties.description: • secret_id - (Optional) The secret ID of the role to log in with. Required unless bind_secret_id is set to false on the role.

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - The unique path of the Vault backend to log in with.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role_name
properties.description: • role_name - (Required) The name of the role to create the SecretID for.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) A JSON-encoded string containing metadata in key-value pairs to be set on tokens issued with this SecretID.

properties.name: cidr_list
properties.description: • cidr_list - (Optional) If set, specifies blocks of IP addresses which can perform the login operation using this SecretID.

properties.name: secret_id
properties.description: • secret_id - (Optional) The SecretID to be created. If set, uses "Push" mode. Defaults to Vault auto-generating SecretIDs.

properties.name: wrapping_ttl
properties.description: • wrapping_ttl - (Optional) If set, the SecretID response will be response-wrapped and available for the duration specified. Only a single unwrapping of the token is allowed.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Type of the audit device, such as 'file'.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (optional) The path to mount the audit device. This defaults to the type.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-friendly description of the audit device.

properties.name: options
properties.description: • options - (Required) Configuration options to pass to the audit device itself.
For a reference of the device types and their options, consult the Vault documentation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The name of the auth method type

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) The path to mount the auth method — this defaults to the name of the type

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the auth method

properties.name: default_lease_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • default_lease_ttl_seconds - (Optional) The default lease duration in seconds.

properties.name: max_lease_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • max_lease_ttl_seconds - (Optional) The maximum lease duration in seconds.

properties.name: listing_visibility
properties.description: • listing_visibility - (Optional) Speficies whether to show this mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint.

properties.name: local
properties.description: • local - (Optional) Specifies if the auth method is local only.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cert_name
properties.description: • cert_name - (Required) The name of the certificate.

properties.name: aws_public_cert
properties.description: • aws_public_cert - (Required) The Base64 encoded AWS Public key required to verify PKCS7 signature of the EC2 instance metadata. You can find this key in the AWS documentation.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Either "pkcs7" or "identity", indicating the type of document which can be verified using the given certificate. Defaults to "pkcs7".

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) The path the AWS auth backend being configured was mounted at. Defaults to aws.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) The path the AWS auth backend being configured was mounted at. Defaults to aws.

properties.name: access_key
properties.description: • access_key - (Optional) The AWS access key that Vault should use for the auth backend.

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: • secret_key - (Optional) The AWS secret key that Vault should use for the auth backend.

properties.name: ec2_endpoint
properties.description: • ec2_endpoint - (Optional) Override the URL Vault uses when making EC2 API calls.

properties.name: iam_endpoint
properties.description: • iam_endpoint - (Optional) Override the URL Vault uses when making IAM API calls.

properties.name: sts_endpoint
properties.description: • sts_endpoint - (Optional) Override the URL Vault uses when making STS API calls.

properties.name: iam_server_id_header_value
properties.description: • iam_server_id_header_value - (Optional) The value to require in the X-Vault-AWS-IAM-Server-ID header as part of GetCallerIdentity requests that are used in the IAM auth method.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) The path of the AWS backend being configured.

properties.name: safety_buffer
properties.description: • safety_buffer - (Optional) The amount of extra time, in minutes, that must have passed beyond the roletag expiration, before it is removed from the backend storage.

properties.name: disable_periodic_tidy
properties.description: • disable_periodic_tidy - (Optional) If set to true, disables the periodic tidying of the identity-whitelist entries.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) The unique name of the AWS auth backend. Defaults to 'aws'.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Optional) The name of the AWS auth backend role to create tokens against.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) The base64-encoded EC2 instance identity document to authenticate with. Can be retrieved from the EC2 metadata server.

properties.name: signature
properties.description: • signature - (Optional) The base64-encoded SHA256 RSA signature of the instance identity document to authenticate with, with all newline characters removed. Can be retrieved from the EC2 metadata server.

properties.name: pkcs7
properties.description: • pkcs7 - (Optional) The PKCS#7 signature of the identity document to authenticate with, with all newline characters removed. Can be retrieved from the EC2 metadata server.

properties.name: nonce
properties.description: • nonce - (Optional) The unique nonce to be used for login requests. Can be set to a user-specified value, or will contain the server-generated value once a token is issued. EC2 instances can only acquire a single token until the whitelist is tidied again unless they keep track of this nonce.

properties.name: iam_http_request_method
properties.description: • iam_http_request_method - (Optional) The HTTP method used in the signed IAM request.

properties.name: iam_request_url
properties.description: • iam_request_url - (Optional) The base64-encoded HTTP URL used in the signed request.

properties.name: iam_request_body
properties.description: • iam_request_body - (Optional) The base64-encoded body of the signed request.

properties.name: iam_request_headers
properties.description: • iam_request_headers - (Optional) The base64-encoded, JSON serialized representation of the GetCallerIdentity HTTP request headers.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The name of the role.

properties.name: auth_type
properties.description: • auth_type - (Optional) The auth type permitted for this role. Valid choices are ec2 and iam. Defaults to iam.

properties.name: bound_ami_ids
properties.description: • bound_ami_ids - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the EC2 instances that can perform the login operation that they should be using the AMI ID specified by this field. auth_type must be set to ec2 or inferred_entity_type must be set to ec2_instance to use this constraint.

properties.name: bound_account_ids
properties.description: • bound_account_ids - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the EC2 instances that can perform the login operation that they should be using the account ID specified by this field. auth_type must be set to ec2 or inferred_entity_type must be set to ec2_instance to use this constraint.

properties.name: bound_regions
properties.description: • bound_regions - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the EC2 instances that can perform the login operation that the region in their identity document must match the one specified by this field. auth_type must be set to ec2 or inferred_entity_type must be set to ec2_instance to use this constraint.

properties.name: bound_vpc_ids
properties.description: • bound_vpc_ids - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the EC2 instances that can perform the login operation that they be associated with the VPC ID that matches the value specified by this field. auth_type must be set to ec2 or inferred_entity_type must be set to ec2_instance to use this constraint.

properties.name: bound_subnet_ids
properties.description: • bound_subnet_ids - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the EC2 instances that can perform the login operation that they be associated with the subnet ID that matches the value specified by this field. auth_type must be set to ec2 or inferred_entity_type must be set to ec2_instance to use this constraint.

properties.name: bound_iam_role_arns
properties.description: • bound_iam_role_arns - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the EC2 instances that can perform the login operation that they must match the IAM role ARN specified by this field. auth_type must be set to ec2 or inferred_entity_type must be set to ec2_instance to use this constraint.

properties.name: bound_iam_instance_profile_arns
properties.description: • bound_iam_instance_profile_arns - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the EC2 instances that can perform the login operation that they must be associated with an IAM instance profile ARN which has a prefix that matches the value specified by this field. The value is prefix-matched as though it were a glob ending in *. auth_type must be set to ec2 or inferred_entity_type must be set to ec2_instance to use this constraint.

properties.name: role_tag
properties.description: • role_tag - (Optional) If set, enable role tags for this role. The value set for this field should be the key of the tag on the EC2 instance. auth_type must be set to ec2 or inferred_entity_type must be set to ec2_instance to use this constraint.

properties.name: bound_iam_principal_arns
properties.description: • bound_iam_principal_arns - (Optional) If set, defines the IAM principal that must be authenticated when auth_type is set to iam. Wildcards are supported at the end of the ARN.

properties.name: inferred_entity_type
properties.description: • inferred_entity_type - (Optional) If set, instructs Vault to turn on inferencing. The only valid value is ec2_instance, which instructs Vault to infer that the role comes from an EC2 instance in an IAM instance profile. This only applies when auth_type is set to iam.

properties.name: inferred_aws_region
properties.description: • inferred_aws_region - (Optional) When inferred_entity_type is set, this is the region to search for the inferred entities. Required if inferred_entity_type is set. This only applies when auth_type is set to iam.

properties.name: resolve_aws_unique_ids
properties.description: • resolve_aws_unique_ids - (Optional, Forces new resource) If set to true, the bound_iam_principal_arns are resolved to AWS Unique IDs for the bound principal ARN. This field is ignored when a bound_iam_principal_arn ends in a wildcard. Resolving to unique IDs more closely mimics the behavior of AWS services in that if an IAM user or role is deleted and a new one is recreated with the same name, those new users or roles won't get access to roles in Vault that were permissioned to the prior principals of the same name. Defaults to true. Once set to true, this cannot be changed to false without recreating the role.

properties.name: allow_instance_migration
properties.description: • allow_instance_migration - (Optional) If set to true, allows migration of the underlying instance where the client resides.

properties.name: disallow_reauthentication
properties.description: • disallow_reauthentication - (Optional) IF set to true, only allows a single token to be granted per instance ID. This can only be set when auth_type is set to ec2.

properties.name: common-token-arguments
properties.description: » Common Token Arguments
These arguments are common across several Authentication Token resources since Vault 1.2.

properties.name: token_ttl
properties.description: • token_ttl - (Optional) The incremental lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_max_ttl - (Optional) The maximum lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_policies
properties.description: • token_policies - (Optional) List of policies to encode onto generated tokens. Depending on the auth method, this list may be supplemented by user/group/other values.

properties.name: token_bound_cidrs
properties.description: • token_bound_cidrs - (Optional) List of CIDR blocks; if set, specifies blocks of IP addresses which can authenticate successfully, and ties the resulting token to these blocks as well.

properties.name: token_explicit_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_explicit_max_ttl - (Optional) If set, will encode an explicit max TTL onto the token in number of seconds. This is a hard cap even if token_ttl and token_max_ttl would otherwise allow a renewal.

properties.name: token_no_default_policy
properties.description: • token_no_default_policy - (Optional) If set, the default policy will not be set on generated tokens; otherwise it will be added to the policies set in token_policies.

properties.name: token_num_uses
properties.description: • token_num_uses - (Optional) The period, if any, in number of seconds to set on the token.

properties.name: token_type
properties.description: • token_type - (Optional) The type of token that should be generated. Can be service, batch, or default to use the mount's tuned default (which unless changed will be service tokens). For token store roles, there are two additional possibilities: default-service and default-batch which specify the type to return unless the client requests a different type at generation time.

properties.name: deprecated-arguments
properties.description: » Deprecated Arguments
These arguments are deprecated since Vault 1.2 in favour of the common token arguments documented above.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_ttl isntead) The TTL period of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

properties.name: max_ttl
properties.description: • max_ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_max_ttl instead) The maximum allowed lifetime of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_policies instead) An array of strings specifying the policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.

properties.name: period
properties.description: • period - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_period instead) If set, indicates that the token generated using this role should never expire. The token should be renewed within the duration specified by this value. At each renewal, the token's TTL will be set to the value of this field. The maximum allowed lifetime of token issued using this role. Specified as a number of seconds.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The name of the AWS auth backend role to read role tags from, with no leading or trailing /s.

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) The path to the AWS auth backend to read role tags from, with no leading or trailing /s. Defaults to "aws".

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional) The policies to be associated with the tag. Must be a subset of the policies associated with the role.

properties.name: max_ttl
properties.description: • max_ttl - (Optional) The maximum TTL of the tokens issued using this role.

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: • instance_id - (Optional) Instance ID for which this tag is intended for. If set, the created tag can only be used by the instance with the given ID.

properties.name: allow_instance_migration
properties.description: • allow_instance_migration - (Optional) If set, allows migration of the underlying instances where the client resides. Use with caution.

properties.name: disallow_reauthentication
properties.description: • disallow_reauthentication - (Optional) If set, only allows a single token to be granted per instance ID.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: account_id
properties.description: • account_id - (Optional) The AWS account ID to configure the STS role for.

properties.name: sts_role
properties.description: • sts_role - (Optional) The STS role to assume when verifying requests made by EC2 instances in the account specified by account_id.

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) The path the AWS auth backend being configured was mounted at. Defaults to aws.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: access_key
properties.description: • access_key - (Required) The AWS Access Key ID this backend should use to issue new credentials.

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: • secret_key - (Required) The AWS Secret Key this backend should use to issue new credentials.

Important Vault version 1.2.3 and older does not support reading the configured credentials back from the API, With these older versions, Terraform cannot detect and correct drift on access_key or secret_key. Changing the values, however, will overwrite the previously stored values. With versions of Vault newer than 1.2.3, reading the access_key only is supported, and so drifts of the access_key will be detected and corrected, but drifts on the secret_key will not.

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Optional) The AWS region for API calls. Defaults to us-east-1.

Important The same limitation noted above for the access_key parameter also applies to the region parameter. Vault versions 1.2.3 and older will not allow Terraform to detect (and thus correct) drift in the region parameter, while newer versions of Vault will.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) The unique path this backend should be mounted at. Must not begin or end with a /. Defaults to aws.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A human-friendly description for this backend.

properties.name: default_lease_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • default_lease_ttl_seconds - (Optional) The default TTL for credentials issued by this backend.

properties.name: max_lease_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • max_lease_ttl_seconds - (Optional) The maximum TTL that can be requested for credentials issued by this backend.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Required) The path the AWS secret backend is mounted at, with no leading or trailing /s.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name to identify this role within the backend. Must be unique within the backend.

properties.name: policy_document
properties.description: • policy_document - (Optional) The JSON-formatted policy to associate with this role. Either policy_document or policy_arns must be specified.

properties.name: policy_arns
properties.description: • policy_arns - (Optional) The ARN for a pre-existing policy to associate with this role. Either policy_document or policy_arns must be specified.

properties.name: role_arns
properties.description: • role_arns - (Optional) Specifies the ARNs of the AWS roles this Vault role is allowed to assume. Required when credential_type is assumed_role and prohibited otherwise.

properties.name: credential_type
properties.description: • credential_type - (Required) Specifies the type of credential to be used when retrieving credentials from the role. Must be one of iam_user, assumed_role, or federation_token.

properties.name: default_sts_ttl
properties.description: • default_sts_ttl - (Optional) The default TTL in seconds for STS credentials. When a TTL is not specified when STS credentials are requested, and a default TTL is specified on the role, then this default TTL will be used. Valid only when credential_type is one of assumed_role or federation_token.

properties.name: max_sts_ttl
properties.description: • max_sts_ttl - (Optional) The max allowed TTL in seconds for STS credentials (credentials TTL are capped to max_sts_ttl). Valid only when credential_type is one of assumed_role or federation_token.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: • tenant_id - (Required) The tenant id for the Azure Active Directory organization.

properties.name: resource
properties.description: • resource - (Required) The configured URL for the application registered in Azure Active Directory.

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) The path the Azure auth backend being configured was mounted at. Defaults to azure.

properties.name: client_id
properties.description: • client_id - (Optional) The client id for credentials to query the Azure APIs. Currently read permissions to query compute resources are required.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: • client_secret - (Optional) The client secret for credentials to query the Azure APIs.

properties.name: environment
properties.description: • environment - (Optional) The Azure cloud environment. Valid values: AzurePublicCloud, AzureUSGovernmentCloud, AzureChinaCloud, AzureGermanCloud. Defaults to AzurePublicCloud.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The name of the role.

properties.name: bound_service_principal_ids
properties.description: • bound_service_principal_ids - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the service principals that can perform the login operation that they should be possess the ids specified by this field.

properties.name: bound_group_ids
properties.description: • bound_group_ids - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the groups that can perform the login operation that they should be using the group ID specified by this field.

properties.name: bound_locations
properties.description: • bound_locations - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the virtual machines that can perform the login operation that the location in their identity document must match the one specified by this field.

properties.name: bound_subscription_ids
properties.description: • bound_subscription_ids - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the subscriptions that can perform the login operation to ones which matches the value specified by this field.

properties.name: bound_resource_groups
properties.description: • bound_resource_groups - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the virtual machiness that can perform the login operation that they be associated with the resource group that matches the value specified by this field.

properties.name: bound_scale_sets
properties.description: • bound_scale_sets - (Optional) If set, defines a constraint on the virtual machines that can perform the login operation that they must match the scale set specified by this field.

These arguments are deprecated since Vault 1.2 in favour of the common token arguments documented above.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_ttl isntead) The TTL period of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

properties.name: max_ttl
properties.description: • max_ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_max_ttl instead) The maximum allowed lifetime of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

properties.description: • policies - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_policies instead) An array of strings specifying the policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: subscription_id
properties.description: (string: <required>) - The subscription id for the Azure Active Directory.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: (string: <required>) - The tenant id for the Azure Active Directory.

properties.name: client_id
properties.description: (string:"") - The OAuth2 client id to connect to Azure.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: (string:"") - The OAuth2 client secret to connect to Azure.

properties.name: environment
properties.description: (string:"") - The Azure environment.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role
properties.description: (Required) Name of the Azure role

properties.name: backend
properties.description: Path to the mounted Azure auth backend

properties.name: azure_roles
properties.description: List of Azure roles to be assigned to the generated service principal.

properties.name: application_object_id
properties.description: Application Object ID for an existing service principal that will be used instead of creating dynamic service principals. If present, azure_roles will be ignored.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: – (Optional) Specifies the default TTL for service principals generated using this role. Accepts time suffixed strings ("1h") or an integer number of seconds. Defaults to the system/engine default TTL time.

properties.name: max_ttl
properties.description: – (Optional) Specifies the maximum TTL for service principals generated using this role. Accepts time suffixed strings ("1h") or an integer number of seconds. Defaults to the system/engine max TTL time.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name

properties.name: certificate

properties.name: allowed_names

properties.name: allowed_common_names
properties.description: • allowed_common_names - (Optional) Allowed the common names for authenticated client certificates

properties.name: allowed_dns_sans
properties.description: • allowed_dns_sans - (Optional) Allowed alternative dns names for authenticated client certificates

properties.name: allowed_email_sans
properties.description: • allowed_email_sans - (Optional) Allowed emails for authenticated client certificates

properties.name: allowed_uri_sans
properties.description: • allowed_uri_sans - (Optional) Allowed URIs for authenticated client certificates

properties.name: allowed_organization_units
properties.description: • allowed_organization_units - (Optional) Allowed organization units for authenticated client certificates

properties.name: required_extensions
properties.description: • required_extensions - (Optional) TLS extensions required on client certificates

properties.name: display_name

properties.name: common-token-arguments
properties.description: » Common Token Arguments
These arguments are common across several Authentication Token resources since Vault 1.2.

properties.name: token_ttl
properties.description: • token_ttl - (Optional) The incremental lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_max_ttl - (Optional) The maximum lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_policies
properties.description: • token_policies - (Optional) List of policies to encode onto generated tokens. Depending on the auth method, this list may be supplemented by user/group/other values.

properties.name: token_bound_cidrs
properties.description: • token_bound_cidrs - (Optional) List of CIDR blocks; if set, specifies blocks of IP addresses which can authenticate successfully, and ties the resulting token to these blocks as well.

properties.name: token_explicit_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_explicit_max_ttl - (Optional) If set, will encode an explicit max TTL onto the token in number of seconds. This is a hard cap even if token_ttl and token_max_ttl would otherwise allow a renewal.

properties.name: token_no_default_policy
properties.description: • token_no_default_policy - (Optional) If set, the default policy will not be set on generated tokens; otherwise it will be added to the policies set in token_policies.

properties.name: token_num_uses
properties.description: • token_num_uses - (Optional) The number of times issued tokens can be used. A value of 0 means unlimited uses.

properties.name: token_num_uses
properties.description: • token_num_uses - (Optional) The period, if any, in number of seconds to set on the token.

properties.name: token_type
properties.description: • token_type - (Optional) The type of token that should be generated. Can be service, batch, or default to use the mount's tuned default (which unless changed will be service tokens). For token store roles, there are two additional possibilities: default-service and default-batch which specify the type to return unless the client requests a different type at generation time.

properties.name: deprecated-arguments
properties.description: » Deprecated Arguments
These arguments are deprecated since Vault 1.2 in favour of the common token arguments documented above.

properties.name: bound_cidrs
properties.description: • bound_cidrs - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_bound_cidrs instead) Restriction usage of the certificates to client IPs falling within the range of the specified CIDRs

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_ttl isntead) The TTL period of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

properties.name: max_ttl
properties.description: • max_ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_max_ttl instead) The maximum allowed lifetime of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_policies instead) An array of strings specifying the policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.

properties.name: period
properties.description: • period - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_period instead) If set, indicates that the token generated using this role should never expire. The token should be renewed within the duration specified by this value. At each renewal, the token's TTL will be set to the value of this field. The maximum allowed lifetime of token issued using this role. Specified as a number of seconds.
For more details on the usage of each argument consult the Vault Cert API documentation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: token
properties.description: (Required) The Consul management token this backend should use to issue new tokens.

Important Because Vault does not support reading the configured token back from the API, Terraform cannot detect and correct drift on token. Changing the value, however, will overwrite the previously stored values.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) The unique location this backend should be mounted at. Must not begin or end with a /. Defaults to consul.

properties.name: description

properties.name: address

properties.name: scheme

properties.name: default_lease_ttl_seconds

properties.name: max_lease_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • max_lease_ttl_seconds - (Optional) The maximum TTL that can be requested for credentials issued by this backend.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.description: • db_name - (Required) The unique name of the database connection to use for the role.

properties.description: • creation_statements - (Required) The database statements to execute when creating a user.

properties.name: max_ttl
properties.description: • max_ttl - (Optional) The maximum number of seconds for leases for this role.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: credentials
properties.description: A JSON string containing the contents of a GCP credentials file. If this value is empty, Vault will try to use Application Default Credentials from the machine on which the Vault server is running.
For more details on the usage of each argument consult the Vault GCP API documentation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) Name of the GCP role

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Type of GCP authentication role (either gce or iam)

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Optional; Deprecated, use bound_projects instead) GCP Project that the role exists within

properties.name: bound_projects
properties.description: • bound_projects - (Optional) An array of GCP project IDs. Only entities belonging to this project can authenticate under the role.

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) Path to the mounted GCP auth backend

properties.name: bound_service_accounts
properties.description: • bound_service_accounts - (Optional) GCP Service Accounts allowed to issue tokens under this role. (Note: Required if role is iam)

properties.name: iam-only-parameters
properties.description: » iam-only Parameters

properties.name: max_jwt_exp
properties.description: • max_jwt_exp - (Optional) The number of seconds past the time of authentication that the login param JWT must expire within. For example, if a user attempts to login with a token that expires within an hour and this is set to 15 minutes, Vault will return an error prompting the user to create a new signed JWT with a shorter exp. The GCE metadata tokens currently do not allow the exp claim to be customized.

properties.name: allow_gce_inference
properties.description: • allow_gce_inference - (Optional) A flag to determine if this role should allow GCE instances to authenticate by inferring service accounts from the GCE identity metadata token.

properties.name: gce-only-parameters
properties.description: » gce-only Parameters
The following parameters are only valid when the role is of type "gce":

properties.name: bound_zones
properties.description: • bound_zones - (Optional) The list of zones that a GCE instance must belong to in order to be authenticated. If bound_instance_groups is provided, it is assumed to be a zonal group and the group must belong to this zone.

properties.name: bound_regions
properties.description: • bound_regions - (Optional) The list of regions that a GCE instance must belong to in order to be authenticated. If bound_instance_groups is provided, it is assumed to be a regional group and the group must belong to this region. If bound_zones are provided, this attribute is ignored.

properties.name: bound_instance_groups
properties.description: • bound_instance_groups - (Optional) The instance groups that an authorized instance must belong to in order to be authenticated. If specified, either bound_zones or bound_regions must be set too.

properties.name: bound_labels
properties.description: • bound_labels - (Optional) A comma-separated list of GCP labels formatted as "key:value" strings that must be set on authorized GCE instances. Because GCP labels are not currently ACL'd, we recommend that this be used in conjunction with other restrictions.

properties.name: bound_projects
properties.description: • bound_projects - (Optional) GCP Projects that the role exists within
For more details on the usage of each argument consult the Vault GCP API documentation.

properties.name: token_ttl

properties.name: token_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_max_ttl - (Optional) The maximum lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_policies
properties.description: • token_policies - (Optional) List of policies to encode onto generated tokens. Depending on the auth method, this list may be supplemented by user/group/other values.

properties.name: token_bound_cidrs
properties.description: • token_bound_cidrs - (Optional) List of CIDR blocks; if set, specifies blocks of IP addresses which can authenticate successfully, and ties the resulting token to these blocks as well.

properties.name: token_explicit_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_explicit_max_ttl - (Optional) If set, will encode an explicit max TTL onto the token in number of seconds. This is a hard cap even if token_ttl and token_max_ttl would otherwise allow a renewal.

properties.name: token_no_default_policy
properties.description: • token_no_default_policy - (Optional) If set, the default policy will not be set on generated tokens; otherwise it will be added to the policies set in token_policies.

properties.name: token_num_uses
properties.description: • token_num_uses - (Optional) The period, if any, in number of seconds to set on the token.

properties.name: token_type
properties.description: • token_type - (Optional) The type of token that should be generated. Can be service, batch, or default to use the mount's tuned default (which unless changed will be service tokens). For token store roles, there are two additional possibilities: default-service and default-batch which specify the type to return unless the client requests a different type at generation time.

properties.name: deprecated-arguments
properties.description: » Deprecated Arguments
These arguments are deprecated since Vault 1.2 in favour of the common token arguments documented above.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_ttl isntead) The TTL period of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

properties.name: max_ttl
properties.description: • max_ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_max_ttl instead) The maximum allowed lifetime of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

The token should be renewed within the duration specified by this value. At each renewal, the token's TTL will be set to the value of this field. The maximum allowed lifetime of token issued using this role. Specified as a number of seconds.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: credentials
properties.description: (Optional) The GCP service account credentials in JSON format.

Important Because Vault does not support reading the configured credentials back from the API, Terraform cannot detect and correct drift on credentials. Changing the values, however, will overwrite the previously stored values.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) The unique path this backend should be mounted at. Must not begin or end with a /. Defaults to gcp.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A human-friendly description for this backend.

properties.name: default_lease_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • default_lease_ttl_seconds - (Optional) The default TTL for credentials issued by this backend. Defaults to '0'.

properties.name: max_lease_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • max_lease_ttl_seconds - (Optional) The maximum TTL that can be requested for credentials issued by this backend. Defaults to '0'.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Required, Forces new resource) Path where the GCP Secrets Engine is mounted

properties.name: roleset
properties.description: • roleset - (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the Roleset to create

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the GCP project that this roleset's service account will belong to.

properties.name: secret_type
properties.description: • secret_type - (Optional, Forces new resource) Type of secret generated for this role set. Accepted values: access_token, service_account_key. Defaults to access_token.

properties.name: token_scopes
properties.description: • token_scopes - (Optional, Required for secret_type = "access_token") List of OAuth scopes to assign to access_token secrets generated under this role set (access_token role sets only).

properties.name: binding
properties.description: • binding - (Required) Bindings to create for this roleset. This can be specified multiple times for multiple bindings. Structure is documented below.
The binding block supports:

properties.name: resource
properties.description: • resource - (Required) Resource or resource path for which IAM policy information will be bound. The resource path may be specified in a few different formats.

properties.name: roles
properties.description: • roles - (Required) List of GCP IAM roles for the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The full logical path at which to write the given data. Consult each backend's documentation to see which endpoints support the PUT methods and to determine whether they also support DELETE and GET.

properties.name: data_json
properties.description: • data_json - (Required) String containing a JSON-encoded object that will be written to the given path as the secret data.

properties.name: disable_read
properties.description: • disable_read - (Optional) True/false. Set this to true if your vault authentication is not able to read the data or if the endpoint does not support the GET method. Setting this to true will break drift detection. You should set this to true for endpoints that are write-only. Defaults to false.

properties.name: disable_delete
properties.description: • disable_delete: - (Optional) True/false. Set this to true if your vault authentication is not able to delete the data or if the endpoint does not support the DELETE method. Defaults to false.

properties.name: ignore_absent_fields
properties.description: • ignore_absent_fields: - (Optional) True/false. If set to true, ignore any fields present when the endpoint is read but that were not in data_json. Also, if a field that was written is not returned when the endpoint is read, treat that field as being up to date. You should set this to true when writing to endpoint that, when read, returns a different set of fields from the ones you wrote, as is common with many configuration endpoints. Defaults to false.

properties.name: write_fields
properties.description: • write_fields: - (Optional). A list of fields that should be returned in write_data_json and write_data. If omitted, data returned by the write operation is not available to the resource or included in state. This helps to avoid accidental storage of sensitive values in state. Some endpoints, such as many dynamic secrets endpoints, return data from writing to an endpoint rather than reading it. You should use write_fields if you need information returned in this way.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The full logical path at which to write the given data. To write data into the "generic" secret backend mounted in Vault by default, this should be prefixed with secret/. Writing to other backends with this resource is possible; consult each backend's documentation to see which endpoints support the PUT and DELETE methods.

properties.name: data_json
properties.description: • data_json - (Required) String containing a JSON-encoded object that will be written as the secret data at the given path.

properties.name: allow_read
properties.description: • allow_read - (Optional, Deprecated) True/false. Set this to true if your vault authentication is able to read the data, this allows the resource to be compared and updated. Defaults to false.

properties.name: disable_read
properties.description: • disable_read - (Optional) True/false. Set this to true if your vault authentication is not able to read the data. Setting this to true will break drift detection. Defaults to false.

properties.name: required-vault-capabilities
properties.description: » Required Vault Capabilities

Use of this resource requires the create or update capability (depending on whether the resource already exists) on the given path, along with the delete capbility if the resource is removed from configuration.

This resource does not read the secret data back from Terraform on refresh by default. This avoids the need for read access on the given path, but it means that Terraform is not able to detect and repair "drift" on this resource should the data be updated or deleted outside of Terraform. This limitation can be negated by setting allow_read to true
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) Path where the auth backend is mounted. Defaults to auth/github if not specified.

properties.name: organization
properties.description: • organization - (Required) The organization configured users must be part of.

properties.name: base_url
properties.description: • base_url - (Optional) The API endpoint to use. Useful if you are running GitHub Enterprise or an API-compatible authentication server.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Specifies the description of the mount. This overrides the current stored value, if any.
The tune block is used to tune the auth backend:

properties.name: default_lease_ttl
properties.description: • default_lease_ttl - (Optional) Specifies the default time-to-live. If set, this overrides the global default. Must be a valid duration string

properties.name: max_lease_ttl
properties.description: • max_lease_ttl - (Optional) Specifies the maximum time-to-live. If set, this overrides the global default. Must be a valid duration string

properties.name: audit_non_hmac_response_keys
properties.description: • audit_non_hmac_response_keys - (Optional) Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the response data object.

properties.name: audit_non_hmac_request_keys
properties.description: • audit_non_hmac_request_keys - (Optional) Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the request data object.

properties.name: listing_visibility
properties.description: • listing_visibility - (Optional) Specifies whether to show this mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint. Valid values are "unauth" or "hidden".

properties.name: passthrough_request_headers
properties.description: • passthrough_request_headers - (Optional) List of headers to whitelist and pass from the request to the backend.

properties.name: allowed_response_headers
properties.description: • allowed_response_headers - (Optional) List of headers to whitelist and allowing a plugin to include them in the response.

properties.name: token_type
properties.description: • token_type - (Optional) Specifies the type of tokens that should be returned by the mount. Valid values are "default-service", "default-batch", "service", "batch".
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Required) Path where the github auth backend is mounted. Defaults to github if not specified.

properties.name: team
properties.description: • team - (Required) GitHub team name in "slugified" format, for example: Terraform Developers -> terraform-developers.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional) An array of strings specifying the policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Required) Path where the github auth backend is mounted. Defaults to github if not specified.

properties.name: user
properties.description: • user - (Required) GitHub user name.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional) An array of strings specifying the policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the identity entity to create.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional) A list of policies to apply to the entity.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) A Map of additional metadata to associate with the user.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: • disabled - (Optional) True/false Is this entity currently disabled. Defaults to false
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the alias. Name should be the identifier of the client in the authentication source. For example, if the alias belongs to userpass backend, the name should be a valid username within userpass backend. If alias belongs to GitHub, it should be the GitHub username.

properties.name: mount_accessor
properties.description: • mount_accessor - (Required) Accessor of the mount to which the alias should belong to.

properties.name: canonical_id
properties.description: • canonical_id - (Required) Entity ID to which this alias belongs to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the identity group to create.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional, Forces new resource) Type of the group, internal or external. Defaults to internal.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional) A list of policies to apply to the group.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) A Map of additional metadata to associate with the group.

properties.name: member_group_ids
properties.description: • member_group_ids - (Optional) A list of Group IDs to be assigned as group members.

properties.name: member_entity_ids
properties.description: • member_entity_ids - (Optional) A list of Entity IDs to be assigned as group members. Not allowed on external groups.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the group alias to create.

properties.name: mount_accessor
properties.description: • mount_accessor - (Required) Mount accessor of the authentication backend to which this alias belongs to.

properties.name: canonical_id
properties.description: • canonical_id - (Required) ID of the group to which this is an alias.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: issuer
properties.description: (Optional) Issuer URL to be used in the iss claim of the token. If not set, Vault's api_addr will be used. The issuer is a case sensitive URL using the https scheme that contains scheme, host, and optionally, port number and path components, but no query or fragment components.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required; Forces new resource) Name of the OIDC Key to create.

properties.name: rotation_period
properties.description: • rotation_period - (Optional) How often to generate a new signing key in number of seconds

properties.name: verification_ttl
properties.description: • verification_ttl - (Optional) "Controls how long the public portion of a signing key will be available for verification after being rotated in seconds.

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: • algorithm - (Optional) Signing algorithm to use. Signing algorithm to use. Allowed values are: RS256 (default), RS384, RS512, ES256, ES384, ES512, EdDSA.

properties.name: allowed_client_ids
properties.description: • allowed_client_ids: Array of role client ID allowed to use this key for signing. If empty, no roles are allowed. If ["*"], all roles are allowed.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: key_name
properties.description: • key_name - (Required; Forces new resource) Name of the OIDC Key allow the Client ID.

properties.name: allowed_client_id
properties.description: • allowed_client_id - (Required; Forces new resource) Client ID to allow usage with the OIDC named key
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required; Forces new resource) Name of the OIDC Role to create.

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (Required; Forces new resource) A configured named key, the key must already exist before tokens can be issued.

properties.name: template
properties.description: • template - (Optional) The template string to use for generating tokens. This may be in string-ified JSON or base64 format. See the documentation for the template format.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional) TTL of the tokens generated against the role in number of seconds.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) Path to mount the JWT/OIDC auth backend

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Type of auth backend. Should be one of jwt or oidc. Default - jwt

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the auth backend

properties.name: oidc_discovery_url
properties.description: • oidc_discovery_url - (Optional) The OIDC Discovery URL, without any .well-known component (base path). Cannot be used in combination with jwt_validation_pubkeys

properties.name: oidc_discovery_ca_pem
properties.description: • oidc_discovery_ca_pem - (Optional) The CA certificate or chain of certificates, in PEM format, to use to validate connections to the OIDC Discovery URL. If not set, system certificates are used

properties.name: oidc_client_id
properties.description: • oidc_client_id - (Optional) Client ID used for OIDC backends

properties.name: oidc_client_secret
properties.description: • oidc_client_secret - (Optional) Client Secret used for OIDC backends

properties.name: jwks_url
properties.description: • jwks_url - (Optional) JWKS URL to use to authenticate signatures. Cannot be used with "oidc_discovery_url" or "jwt_validation_pubkeys".

properties.name: jwks_ca_pem
properties.description: • jwks_ca_pem - (Optional) The CA certificate or chain of certificates, in PEM format, to use to validate connections to the JWKS URL. If not set, system certificates are used.

properties.name: jwt_validation_pubkeys
properties.description: • jwt_validation_pubkeys - (Optional) A list of PEM-encoded public keys to use to authenticate signatures locally. Cannot be used in combination with oidc_discovery_url

properties.name: bound_issuer
properties.description: • bound_issuer - (Optional) The value against which to match the iss claim in a JWT

properties.name: jwt_supported_algs
properties.description: • jwt_supported_algs - (Optional) A list of supported signing algorithms. Vault 1.1.0 defaults to [RS256] but future or past versions of Vault may differ

properties.name: default_role
properties.description: • default_role - (Optional) The default role to use if none is provided during login
The tune block is used to tune the auth backend:

properties.name: default_lease_ttl
properties.description: • default_lease_ttl - (Optional) Specifies the default time-to-live. If set, this overrides the global default. Must be a valid duration string

properties.name: max_lease_ttl
properties.description: • max_lease_ttl - (Optional) Specifies the maximum time-to-live. If set, this overrides the global default. Must be a valid duration string

properties.name: audit_non_hmac_response_keys
properties.description: • audit_non_hmac_response_keys - (Optional) Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the response data object.

properties.name: audit_non_hmac_request_keys
properties.description: • audit_non_hmac_request_keys - (Optional) Specifies the list of keys that will not be HMAC'd by audit devices in the request data object.

properties.name: listing_visibility
properties.description: • listing_visibility - (Optional) Specifies whether to show this mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint. Valid values are "unauth" or "hidden".

properties.name: passthrough_request_headers
properties.description: • passthrough_request_headers - (Optional) List of headers to whitelist and pass from the request to the backend.

properties.name: allowed_response_headers
properties.description: • allowed_response_headers - (Optional) List of headers to whitelist and allowing a plugin to include them in the response.

properties.name: token_type
properties.description: • token_type - (Optional) Specifies the type of tokens that should be returned by the mount. Valid values are "default-service", "default-batch", "service", "batch".
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role_name
properties.description: • role_name - (Required) The name of the role.

properties.name: role_type
properties.description: • role_type - (Optional) Type of role, either "oidc" (default) or "jwt".

properties.name: bound_audiences
properties.description: • bound_audiences - (Required) List of aud claims to match against. Any match is sufficient.

properties.name: user_claim
properties.description: • user_claim - (Required) The claim to use to uniquely identify the user; this will be used as the name for the Identity entity alias created due to a successful login.

properties.name: bound_subject
properties.description: • bound_subject - (Optional) If set, requires that the sub claim matches this value.

properties.name: bound_claims
properties.description: • bound_claims - (Optional) If set, a map of claims/values to match against. The expected value may be a single string or a list of strings.

properties.name: claim_mappings
properties.description: • claim_mappings - (Optional) If set, a map of claims (keys) to be copied to specified metadata fields (values).

properties.name: oidc_scopes
properties.description: • oidc_scopes - (Optional) If set, a list of OIDC scopes to be used with an OIDC role. The standard scope "openid" is automatically included and need not be specified.

properties.name: groups_claim
properties.description: • groups_claim - (Optional) The claim to use to uniquely identify the set of groups to which the user belongs; this will be used as the names for the Identity group aliases created due to a successful login. The claim value must be a list of strings.

properties.name: groups_claim_delimiter_pattern
properties.description: • groups_claim_delimiter_pattern - (Optional; Deprecated. This field has been removed since Vault 1.1. If the groups claim is not at the top level, it can now be specified as a JSONPointer.) A pattern of delimiters used to allow the groups_claim to live outside of the top-level JWT structure. For instance, a groups_claim of meta/user.name/groups with this field set to // will expect nested structures named meta, user.name, and groups. If this field was set to /./ the groups information would expect to be via nested structures of meta, user, name, and groups.

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) The unique name of the auth backend to configure. Defaults to jwt.

properties.name: allowed_redirect_uris
properties.description: • allowed_redirect_uris - (Optional) The list of allowed values for redirect_uri during OIDC logins. Required for OIDC roles

properties.name: common-token-arguments
properties.description: » Common Token Arguments
These arguments are common across several Authentication Token resources since Vault 1.2.

properties.name: token_ttl
properties.description: • token_ttl - (Optional) The incremental lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_max_ttl - (Optional) The maximum lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_policies
properties.description: • token_policies - (Optional) List of policies to encode onto generated tokens. Depending on the auth method, this list may be supplemented by user/group/other values.

properties.name: token_bound_cidrs
properties.description: • token_bound_cidrs - (Optional) List of CIDR blocks; if set, specifies blocks of IP addresses which can authenticate successfully, and ties the resulting token to these blocks as well.

properties.name: token_explicit_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_explicit_max_ttl - (Optional) If set, will encode an explicit max TTL onto the token in number of seconds. This is a hard cap even if token_ttl and token_max_ttl would otherwise allow a renewal.

properties.name: token_no_default_policy
properties.description: • token_no_default_policy - (Optional) If set, the default policy will not be set on generated tokens; otherwise it will be added to the policies set in token_policies.

properties.name: token_num_uses
properties.description: • token_num_uses - (Optional) The period, if any, in number of seconds to set on the token.

properties.name: token_type
properties.description: • token_type - (Optional) The type of token that should be generated. Can be service, batch, or default to use the mount's tuned default (which unless changed will be service tokens). For token store roles, there are two additional possibilities: default-service and default-batch which specify the type to return unless the client requests a different type at generation time.

properties.name: deprecated-arguments
properties.description: » Deprecated Arguments
These arguments are deprecated since Vault 1.2 in favour of the common token arguments documented above.

properties.name: num_uses
properties.description: • num_uses - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_num_uses instead) If set, puts a use-count limitation on the issued token.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_ttl isntead) The TTL period of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

properties.name: max_ttl
properties.description: • max_ttl - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_max_ttl instead) The maximum allowed lifetime of tokens issued using this role, provided as a number of seconds.

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_policies instead) An array of strings specifying the policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.

properties.name: period
properties.description: • period - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_period instead) If set, indicates that the token generated using this role should never expire. The token should be renewed within the duration specified by this value. At each renewal, the token's TTL will be set to the value of this field. The maximum allowed lifetime of token issued using this role. Specified as a number of seconds.

properties.name: bound_cidrs
properties.description: • bound_cidrs - (Optional; Deprecated, use token_bound_cidrs instead) If set, a list of CIDRs valid as the source address for login requests. This value is also encoded into any resulting token.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: kubernetes_host
properties.description: • kubernetes_host - (Required) Host must be a host string, a host:port pair, or a URL to the base of the Kubernetes API server.

properties.name: kubernetes_ca_cert
properties.description: • kubernetes_ca_cert - (Optional) PEM encoded CA cert for use by the TLS client used to talk with the Kubernetes API.

properties.name: token_reviewer_jwt
properties.description: • token_reviewer_jwt - (Optional) A service account JWT used to access the TokenReview API to validate other JWTs during login. If not set the JWT used for login will be used to access the API.

properties.name: pem_keys
properties.description: • pem_keys - (Optional) List of PEM-formatted public keys or certificates used to verify the signatures of Kubernetes service account JWTs. If a certificate is given, its public key will be extracted. Not every installation of Kubernetes exposes these keys.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: role_name
properties.description: • role_name - (Required) Name of the role.

properties.name: bound_service_account_names
properties.description: • bound_service_account_names - (Required) List of service account names able to access this role. If set to ["*"] all names are allowed, both this and bound_service_account_namespaces can not be "*".

properties.name: bound_service_account_namespaces
properties.description: • bound_service_account_namespaces - (Required) List of namespaces allowed to access this role. If set to ["*"] all namespaces are allowed, both this and bound_service_account_names can not be set to "*".

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) Unique name of the kubernetes backend to configure.

The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: url
properties.description: • url - (Required) The URL of the LDAP server

properties.name: starttls

properties.name: tls_min_version
properties.description: • tls_min_version - (Optional) Minimum acceptable version of TLS

properties.name: tls_max_version

properties.name: certificate

properties.name: binddn

properties.name: bindpass

properties.name: userattr

properties.name: upndomain

properties.name: discoverdn
properties.description: • discoverdn: (Optional) Use anonymous bind to discover the bind DN of a user.

properties.name: deny_null_bind
properties.description: • deny_null_bind: (Optional) Prevents users from bypassing authentication when providing an empty password.

properties.name: upndomain
properties.description: • upndomain: (Optional) The userPrincipalDomain used to construct the UPN string for the authenticating user.

properties.name: groupfilter

properties.name: groupdn
properties.description: • groupdn - (Optional) Base DN under which to perform group search

properties.name: groupattr
properties.description: • groupattr - (Optional) LDAP attribute to follow on objects returned by groupfilter

properties.name: use_token_groups

properties.name: common-token-arguments
properties.description: » Common Token Arguments
These arguments are common across several Authentication Token resources since Vault 1.2.

properties.name: token_ttl
properties.description: • token_ttl - (Optional) The incremental lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_max_ttl - (Optional) The maximum lifetime for generated tokens in number of seconds. Its current value will be referenced at renewal time.

properties.name: token_policies
properties.description: • token_policies - (Optional) List of policies to encode onto generated tokens. Depending on the auth method, this list may be supplemented by user/group/other values.

properties.name: token_bound_cidrs
properties.description: • token_bound_cidrs - (Optional) List of CIDR blocks; if set, specifies blocks of IP addresses which can authenticate successfully, and ties the resulting token to these blocks as well.

properties.name: token_explicit_max_ttl
properties.description: • token_explicit_max_ttl - (Optional) If set, will encode an explicit max TTL onto the token in number of seconds. This is a hard cap even if token_ttl and token_max_ttl would otherwise allow a renewal.

properties.name: token_no_default_policy
properties.description: • token_no_default_policy - (Optional) If set, the default policy will not be set on generated tokens; otherwise it will be added to the policies set in token_policies.

properties.name: token_num_uses
properties.description: • token_num_uses - (Optional) The number of times issued tokens can be used. A value of 0 means unlimited uses.

properties.name: token_num_uses
properties.description: • token_num_uses - (Optional) The period, if any, in number of seconds to set on the token.

properties.name: token_type
properties.description: • token_type - (Optional) The type of token that should be generated. Can be service, batch, or default to use the mount's tuned default (which unless changed will be service tokens). For token store roles, there are two additional possibilities: default-service and default-batch which specify the type to return unless the client requests a different type at generation time.
For more details on the usage of each argument consult the Vault LDAP API documentation.

Important Because Vault does not support reading the configured credentials back from the API, Terraform cannot detect and correct drift on bindpass. Changing the values, however, will overwrite the previously stored values.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) The LDAP username

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional) Policies which should be granted to user

properties.name: groups
properties.description: • groups - (Optional) Override LDAP groups which should be granted to user

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) Path to the authentication backend
For more details on the usage of each argument consult the Vault LDAP API documentation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: groupname
properties.description: • groupname - (Required) The LDAP groupname

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional) Policies which should be granted to members of the group

properties.name: backend
properties.description: • backend - (Optional) Path to the authentication backend
For more details on the usage of each argument consult the Vault LDAP API documentation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name (string: <required>) – Name of the MFA method.

properties.name: mount_accessor
properties.description: • mount_accessor (string: <required>) - The mount to tie this method to for use in automatic mappings. The mapping will use the Name field of Aliases associated with this mount as the username in the mapping.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: username_format (string) - A format string for mapping Identity names to MFA method names. Values to substitute should be placed in {{}}. For example, "{{alias.name}}@example.com". If blank, the Alias's Name field will be used as-is. Currently-supported mappings:

properties.name: mount_accessor
properties.description: • alias.name: The name returned by the mount configured via the mount_accessor parameter

properties.name: entity.name: The name configured for the Entity
properties.description: • entity.name: The name configured for the Entity

properties.name: <key>
properties.description: • alias.metadata.<key>: The value of the Alias's metadata parameter

properties.name: <key>
properties.description: • entity.metadata.<key>: The value of the Entity's metadata parameter

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: • secret_key (string: <required>) - Secret key for Duo.

properties.name: integration_key
properties.description: • integration_key (string: <required>) - Integration key for Duo.

properties.name: api_hostname
properties.description: • api_hostname (string: <required>) - API hostname for Duo.

properties.name: push_info
properties.description: • push_info (string) - Push information for Duo.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) Where the secret backend will be mounted

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Type of the backend, such as "aws"

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Human-friendly description of the mount

properties.name: default_lease_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • default_lease_ttl_seconds - (Optional) Default lease duration for tokens and secrets in seconds

properties.name: max_lease_ttl_seconds
properties.description: • max_lease_ttl_seconds - (Optional) Maximum possible lease duration for tokens and secrets in seconds

properties.name: local
properties.description: • local - (Optional) Boolean flag that can be explicitly set to true to enforce local mount in HA environment

properties.name: options
properties.description: • options - (Optional) Specifies mount type specific options that are passed to the backend
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: path
properties.description: (Required) The path of the namespace. Must not have a trailing /
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) Path to mount the Okta auth backend

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the auth backend

properties.name: organization
properties.description: • organization - (Required) The Okta organization. This will be the first part of the url https://XXX.okta.com

properties.name: token
properties.description: • token - (Optional) The Okta API token. This is required to query Okta for user group membership. If this is not supplied only locally configured groups will be enabled.

properties.name: base_url
properties.description: • base_url - (Optional) The Okta url. Examples: oktapreview.com, okta.com

properties.name: bypass_okta_mfa
properties.description: • bypass_okta_mfa - (Optional) When true, requests by Okta for a MFA check will be bypassed. This also disallows certain status checks on the account, such as whether the password is expired.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: • ttl - (Optional) Duration after which authentication will be expired. See the documentation for info on valid duration formats.

properties.name: max_ttl
properties.description: • max_ttl - (Optional) Maximum duration after which authentication will be expired See the documentation for info on valid duration formats.

properties.name: group
properties.description: • group - (Optional) Associate Okta groups with policies within Vault. See below for more details.

properties.name: user
properties.description: • user - (Optional) Associate Okta users with groups or policies within Vault. See below for more details.

properties.name: okta-group
properties.description: » Okta Group

properties.name: group_name
properties.description: • group_name - (Required) Name of the group within the Okta

properties.name: policies
properties.description: • policies - (Optional) Vault policies to associate with this group

properties.name: okta-user
properties.description: » Okta User

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required Optional) Name of the user within Okta

properties.name: groups
properties.description: • groups - (Optional) List of Okta groups to associate with this user

properties.name: policies
